meanings.definition: A person who hits a home run in baseball.
meanings.sent1: The young boy became a homer when he hit the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered as the player became a homer with his powerful swing.
meanings.sent3: The homer grinned widely as he rounded the bases, proud of his achievement.
meanings.sent4: His homer was like a lightning bolt, striking the ball far into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The homer's victory dance after hitting the home run was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A unit of measure equal to 1,200 feet.
meanings.sent1: The hiker walked a homer's distance along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The construction project required laying pipes over several homers.
meanings.sent3: It took them a whole day to walk just one homer's length.
meanings.sent4: The road stretched out for miles, each homer marked by a milestone.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner had only one homer left to reach the finish line.

meanings.sent1: The homer cooed softly in its nest.
meanings.sent2: The flock of homers flew gracefully across the sky.
meanings.sent3: The homer strutted proudly, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent4: The homer's wings glinted in the sunlight as it soared above the trees.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled as they fed breadcrumbs to the friendly homer in the park.
